E110.name: Sunset Yellow FCF (Orange Yellow S, FD&C Yellow 6)
E110.status: Restricted use EU, Banned Norway, EU warnings/phasing out, Approved US.

E121.name: Citrus Red 2
E121.status: Approved in US only for colouring orange skin.

E122.name: Carmoisine (azorubine)
E122.status: Approved in EU. Banned in Canada, Japan, Norway, USA. EU evaluating health risks.

E123.name: Amaranth (FD&C Red 2)
E123.status: Approved in EU. Banned in United States.

E125.name: Ponceau SX, Scarlet GN
E125.status: Only permitted for externally applied drugs and cosmetics in the US.

E127.name: Erythrosine (FD&C Red 3)
E127.status: Approved in EU. Banned in the US.

E129.name: Allura Red AC (FD&C Red 40)
E129.status: Approved in EU and US. Banned in Switzerland. Undergoing voluntary phase out in UK.

E131.name: Patent Blue V
E131.status: Approved in EU. Banned in US and Australia.

E141.name: Copper complexes of chlorophylls and chlorophyllins

E143.name: Fast Green FCF (FD&C Green 3)
E143.status: Approved in US. Banned in the EU.

E153.name: Vegetable carbon
E153.status: Approved in EU. Banned in the US.

E160a.name: Alpha-carotene, Beta-carotene, Gamma-carotene
E160a.status: Approved in EU. Only beta-carotene approved in US.

E160d.name: Lycopene
E160d.status: Restricted use approved in EU. Approved in US.

E161g.name: Canthaxanthin
E161g.status: Not approved in EU. Approved in US.

E171.name: Titanium dioxide
E171.status: No longer approved in EU (June 2022) due to potential carcinogenic effects. Approved in US.

E172.name: Iron oxides and iron hydroxides
E172.status: Approved in EU. Approved in US for sausage casings.

E249.name: Potassium nitrite
E249.status: Approved in EU. Described as 'cancer risk' by Yuka.

E264.name: Ammonium acetate
E264.status: Approved in Australia and New Zealand.

E304.name: Fatty acid esters of ascorbic acid (Ascorbyl palmitate)

E343.name: Magnesium phosphates
E343.status: Approved in EU. Under discussion for future amendment.

E385.name: Calcium disodium ethylene diamine tetraacetate, (Calcium disodium EDTA)

E425.name: Konjac
E425.status: Approved in EU. May not be used in confectionery due to choking risk.

E468.name: Crosslinked sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (Croscarmellose)
E468.status: Approved in EU. Under discussion for future amendment.

E470a.name: Sodium, potassium and calcium salts of fatty acids

E471.name: Mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472a.name: Acetic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472b.name: Lactic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472c.name: Citric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472d.name: Tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472e.name: Mono- and diacetyl tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E472f.name: Mixed acetic and tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E477.name: Propane-1,2-diol esters of fatty acids, propylene glycol esters of fatty acid

E478.name: Lactylated fatty acid esters of glycerol and propane-1

E479b.name: Thermally oxidized soya bean oil interacted with mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

E498.name: Partial polyglycerol esters of polycondensed fatty acids of castor oil

E912.name: Montanic acid esters, Montan acid esters

E927a.name: Azodicarbonamide
E927a.status: Identified as a Substance of Very High Concern in EU.

E952.name: Cyclamic acid and its sodium and calcium salts, also known as Cyclamate

E954.name: Saccharin and its sodium, potassium and calcium salts

E1400.name: Dextrin (Dextrins, roasted starch white and yellow)

E1420.name: Starch acetate esterified with acetic anhydride

E1421.name: Starch acetate esterified with vinyl acetate
